comments.article: Ok.
but....  they are so....  well...  oh ok.

but I have these obnoxious goats running all over the place. It's a regular goat infestation.  Have you ever *smelled* a billy goat? I find that feeding their Gruff little selves to the trolls is truly the best form of goat control. I mean... really.
you beat me to this joke.  >D Well done.
what if we feed them the broken remains of the Patriots?
Aw, George! Why do people gotta be like that?
there were trolls?
There are always trolls.  They're like the death and taxes of the internet.
Cave or mountain?

comments.subject: Trolls are a sure sign you've arrived.

comments.upictitle: Creepy, Weird and Needs to Eat a Sandwich!: black mage
comments.article: i'm fresh out of troll food.  ;)
er.... ::drops a stack of cookies::

Does that mean your ADDING TROLLS TO DANCE OF DRAGONS!!

OH YEAH!!!!

lol

I kid I kid
LOL!

Poor starving trolls, denied even their billy goat dinners. Which raises the question: if you wrote trolls, would you write big Tolkienesque monstrosities or classical fellows that can hide under footbridges? And really, since Gregor ate the Goat (well, in a manner of speaking) does that make HIM the troll?
I didn't realize there was a troll problem in this neighborhood.  Who knew?

There is not a troll problem. The problem is that 99.9% of the people who post here are incapable of doing anything other than post;

"Oh Gidge, I love you! I do not even know you, but I read one of your books once so I feel connected to you in all facets of your life! I know that Feast for Crows sucked, but I don't care, because we are friends! Lets talk together in olde english even though you are from a dumpy port town in NJ. Huzzah!"

Anyone who does not post something to that effect is called a troll. Everyone here is an idiotic fanboy. They resent being called fanboy because they find it "cliche", then they go ahead and call people trolls, an equally overused term.

The people here are idiots. There was a woman once that said that Gidge's smile could light up the world, and she hoped that he would send his smile around the world to her... Believe it.

Trolls? What trolls?

There's no need to attack anyone for their point of view. And, there's no gain in feeling attacked when someone replies to yours in an obviously foolish manner.

Ok, no more Dr. Phil for me.

I'm a Pats fan, but you know what? I've never had to tear anyone else down for their fanhood -- I can root for my team without ripping on your team -- well, unless it's the Yankees, and then that's just genetic. Anyway, I disagree with Mr. Martin that it was a great Super Bowl, and not just 'cause the result wasn't to my liking -- I just didn't find it that exciting on either side.

It seems that around 10pm EST Sunday night there was a huge explosion of idiocy on the Internets, a place already crowded with morons.

Never understood why people can't just root for their teams without being asses to each other.

comments.subject: Damn

comments.article:
It's pointless to reply to any of said troll's posts. It's so tempting but you'll never have the last word or have them admit any kind of wrongdoing. It only serves their purpose which is to put useless drivel on this journal that might scare off new people from participating or worse, encourage GRRM to disable comments.

Every village has their idiot it seems.
comments.subject: Precisely

comments.article: May I feed them to the dragons?
Ok, give me a cool sword and I'll clean your journal of Mountain and Cave Trolls =D

If you care to, livejournal has a mechanism for banning any lj user from posting comments to your blog.

I've had to do it for one of my communities. I also used a setting so that anonymous posts are screened (which I found cut down on trollish behavior).

George has already disabled anon posters AND blocked certain LJ accounts from posting to his blog. The problem appears to be that LJ does not have an IP address blocker. So anyone can be banned with one account and simply create a new one in order to continue to harass someone.

I am surprised that LJ does not have an IP address blocking feature, though...
comments.subject: Good idea
